poem:
"Crossings"

On the wings of history, echoed in newsprint,
Shirley soars over Selma,
Her unbroken spirit, unbought and unbossed,
Making shadows on Edmund Pettus Bridge.
In every echo of her firsts,
I hear footfall on Capitol carpets,
Palms clasped over nomination papers,
A march marked neither by gender nor color, 
But the audacity of crossing over.
